race.name: Marly Grav
race.tagline: Short, steep, and intense gravel through Limburg hills and Ch√¢teau Marly, Netherlands.

terrain.surface: Gravel roads through Dutch countryside. Minimal to moderate elevation with countryside scenery.

gravel_god_rating.score_note: Regional Dutch event. Flat to rolling terrain with moderate organization and regional field.

biased_opinion.summary: Marly Grav is a regional event in Netherlands‚Äîflat to rolling terrain with minimal to moderate elevation. The Dutch countryside is nice, but the moderate organization and regional field keep it firmly in Tier 3. Netherlands provides good access.
biased_opinion.bottom_line: A solid regional Dutch gravel race with flat to rolling terrain. Worth it for Dutch/European cyclists. Not a destination race for international travelers.

final_verdict.should_you_race: If you're in Netherlands/Europe and want a local event‚Äîyes, it's solid. If you're international‚Äîthere are better options.
final_verdict.alternatives: For similar regional events: other Dutch gravel races. For more elevation: Belgian or German gravel races.

logistics.food: Netherlands has full dining options. Stock nutrition.

course_description.signature_challenge: Dutch flat to rolling gravel with wind.

non_negotiables.why: Dutch flat to rolling terrain requires sustained effort.
Dutch summer weather is variable with wind.
Flat to rolling terrain requires pacing discipline.

topics.weather: Riding in variable Dutch weather with wind

marketplace_variables.race_hook_detail: Regional event with flat to rolling terrain.

logistics.explanation: Maurice notes the race was "perfectly organized, a friendly atmosphere," while Sebastiaan highlights "the course was well marked and there were volunteers everywhere to ensure safety." The Shimano Experience Center provides proper facilities including changing rooms, showers, secure lockers, and barista coffee service for the 2,550 riders from 26 nations.

length.explanation: The 155km elite distance demands sustained effort‚ÄîTim Wellens averaged 35.6 km/h for his 4:21:17 victory, while Lorena Wiebes required 5:19:46 for the same distance at 29.1 km/h. The course structure of three loops totaling approximately 155km provides adequate challenge without excessive duration for the European gravel scene. Similar distance to Crusher in the Tushar.

technicality.explanation: "About 60 percent of the course consists of unpaved roads: gravel paths, field roads and sunken lanes" with the unique Gemeentegrot Valkenburg cave passage where "you ride through a centuries-old marl cave with your bike." Semi-slick tires are recommended for dry conditions on these South Limburg white roads and loose soil surfaces. Less technical than The Mid South.

elevation.explanation: The 155km route features approximately 1,510m of climbing through rolling South Limburg terrain. "Imagine: you clip in, take a deep breath, and boom: straight up the Cauberg. No time to warm up gradually." The persistent undulation provides steady climbing rather than meaningful altitude challenges in the Netherlands' modest hills. Flatter profile than Croatan Buck Fifty.

climate.explanation: Historical weather data shows average highs of 64¬∞F and lows of 47¬∞F, with a 60% chance of rain on any given day, and gusts reaching 30 mph. May racing conditions in South Limburg allow for semi-slick tire recommendations in typical dry weather, supporting manageable racing for the international field of 2,550 participants. The Gemeentegrot cave section provides constant cool temperatures as a unique climate refuge during the race effort. Similar climate challenges to SBT GRVL.

altitude.explanation: Valkenburg sits in South Limburg's lowland hills where altitude considerations for performance are nonexistent. The underground Gemeentegrot cave passage represents the most notable elevation variation, diving below ground level rather than gaining meaningful altitude in this Dutch racing region. Lower altitude than Gravel Worlds ‚Äî no thin-air concerns.

adventure.explanation: "Don't expect endless straight gravel roads like in the Achterhoek or Drenthe. Here everything is shorter, steeper and more intense. Climbing, steering, biting down." The route passes through Ch√¢teau St. Gerlach Sculpture Park and marl cliffs from old quarries, providing civilized European exploration rather than wilderness adventure.

prestige.explanation: Tim Wellens arrived "fresh off a 3rd place finish on the white gravel roads of Strade Bianche" and secured his UCI Gravel World Championships front row start with victory. Europe's largest one-day gravel event attracts WorldTour talent and cycling legends, though it's still establishing competitive identity in gravel's hierarchy.

race_quality.explanation: WorldTour participation from UAE Team Emirates and Soudal Quick Step elevates competitive standards, but field depth remains inconsistent‚Äîamateur Malou Eisen finished six minutes faster than elite winner Lorena Wiebes at 5:13:46. The UCI Gravel World Series designation provides structure for this developing event.

experience.explanation: Racing begins immediately on the Cauberg climb "known from the Amstel Gold Race and countless World Championships, forces you to be awake from meter one." The Valkenburg setting delivers cycling culture through castles, natural monuments, and the surreal underground cave passage in cycling's heartland.

community.explanation: "A staggering 2550 riders from 26 nations" creates Europe's largest one-day gravel gathering, attracting "legendary figures of cycling like Johan Museeuw, Sven Nys, Greg Van Avermaet." The three-day festival includes social rides, workshops, and "Limburg festival atmosphere" centered at the Shimano Experience Center.

field_depth.explanation: Elite competition includes double vice world champion Florian Vermeersch, Tim Wellens, and Yves Lampaert from major WorldTour teams. However, the fastest woman overall was amateur Malou Eisen at 5:13:46, finishing six minutes ahead of elite winner Lorena Wiebes, revealing uneven competitive depth across categories. Less competitive depth than Almanzo 100.

value.explanation: Early bird registration offers ‚Ç¨14 discount for access to Europe's largest one-day gravel event with UCI World Championships qualification opportunities. The multi-day festival includes bikepacking, workshops, bike expo, and afterparty at the Shimano Experience Center, delivering substantial value beyond the race itself.

expenses.explanation: Registration runs ‚Ç¨60-100. Netherlands pricing means expensive accommodation, food, and fuel in this cycling tourism hotspot. The race provides accommodation resources including camping at Wildbach Camping in nearby Hellenthal, but Western European rates apply for all basics in the Valkenburg area during cycling season. Higher total cost than Badlands.

citations.label: RideWithGPS: Marly Grav Race 2025 - Course 100 km

primary.name: Specialized Pathfinder Pro
primary.why: Fast center, grippy edges. The modern all-rounder benchmark.

front_rear_split.rationale: Faster front for reduced rolling resistance on straights, grippier rear for traction on loose climbs and corners

videos.title: SPRINT FINISH at Marly Grav Race (155km) UCI GRAVEL in Valkenburg
videos.description:
Tof dat je mijn filmpjes kijkt! Ben je enthousiast, gooi een duimpje omhoog en wil je niets missen, abonneer je dan vooral!

Vandaag de gravel wedstrijd van Marly Grav in Valkenburg. Een 155km lange gravelwedstrijd door de limburgse heuvels. 3 rondjes van net iets meer dan 50km. Ieder rondje is hetzelfde, maar toch net weer ietsje anders. We beginnen met de cauberg, zonder noordelijke lus. Dan de mergelgrotte met de noordelijke lus en uiteindelijk een onverhard alternatief voor de cauberg met nog eens de noordelijke lus. De klimmetjes zijn niet langer dan 2km, dus dat is redelijk te overzien. Het totaal aantal hoogtemeters valt ook nog wel mee, al betekent dat het in de wedstrijd alleen maar harder zal gaan... Een taaie kluif dus, laten we snel gaan kijken!

Volg mij ook online:
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/koenego/
Strava: https://www.strava.com/athletes/552035
Tiktok: https://www.tiktok.com/@koenego
Twitter: https://twitter.com/KoenTimmermans
Threads: komt zo spoedig mogelijk!

Wordt lid van dit kanaal en krijg toegang tot SPECIALE MOGELIJKHEDEN!
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCR6RouXkjqfd69Cn2NZL7Ow/join
videos.curation_reason: First-person race experience from the actual Marly Grav race with good production quality and details about the 155km course through Limburg hills.

Watch the Men Elite highlights of the 2025 Bolero UCI Gravel World Championships in Zuid-Linburg, Netherlands.

videos.title: 2025 UCI Gravel World Championship M40-44 (some highlights in description)
videos.description:
Sorry for the rattling noise, guys! üîä My power bank wasn‚Äôt properly plugged in, which made the USB cover rattle. Everything was hanging underneath my handlebars, so I couldn‚Äôt see it during the race.

Because of that, I could only record for about 2 hours. Lesson learned for next time! üòÖ


UCI Gravel World Championship ‚Äî Beek, South Limburg (NL) üåç
First 60k of the race I‚Äôd been looking so hard forward to after I qualified myself for the worlds in Turnhout. Everything was on track until a virus hit me ten days before the start ü§í A few days stuck in bed, a full week off the bike üö´üö¥, and then ‚Äî with only a few days left ‚Äî some short rides to see if I could still make it.

Before the start, I was honestly just happy to be there üôå After being sick, standing on that start line felt like a small victory in itself. The start actually went surprisingly well ‚Äî probably pure adrenaline ‚ö° ‚Äî but pretty fast, reality kicked in. Burning lungs, a runny nose, and no air left. I pulled the plug around 86k. The body said no. üíÄ

Huge respect for all the riders from 53 different countries üåé ‚Äî the level was insane, absolute beasts out there üí™

Now, looking back, the disappointment hits hard‚Ä¶ but still, it‚Äôs an experience I‚Äôll never forget ‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äçüî•

Were you there at Gravel Worlds, or did you watch it?
Let me know what you thought of the race in the comments! üëá

Subscribe for more gravel race stories üö¥‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èüî•

videos.title: CHAOTIC start into my life on the Road on Tenerife!
videos.description:
And here we go again!

I am Giant Cheerio, a bicycle traveler, exploring the world by bike since 2021.
After spending 6 months off the bike it is time for a next adventure!
I am escaping the cold by taking my bike to Tenerife (aka Canary Islands) and let me tell you one thing:
It's gonna get CHAOTIC!
I didn't do a final equipment check before leaving, which turned out to be a huge mistake!
First day on the Islands &  I already had to use my duct tape. 
I had to find a solution!!

Lean back & enjoy watching my little chaos!

Cheerio, Goodbye, Salut & Adios!


üôå Do you want to support my journey?

üèï Kofi: 
https://ko-fi.com/giant_cheerio

üèï Patreon:
https://www.patreon.com/giant_cheerio....

0:00 Intro
0:49 Off to Tenerife 
01:49 New day! 
03:35 Messy Chaos!
05:05 Cycling Tenerife
06:03 Where will I go to?
07:28 A place off grid
08:17 Solving the chaos
8:40 Outro
